localizedDescriptions.en: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.

annotations.comment: Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.

localizedDescriptions.en: The rate and associated attributes for a pulse or heart beat.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The rate of the pulse or heart beat, measured in beats per minute.
A measurement of the body temperature, which is a surrogate for the core body temperature of the individual.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.

annotations.comment: Height is measured with the individual in a standing position and body length in a recumbent position.

localizedDescriptions.en: Measurement of the body weight of an individual.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Blood oxygen and related measurements, measured by pulse oximetry or pulse CO-oximetry.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
The saturation of oxygen in the peripheral blood, measured via pulse oximetry.

annotations.comment: SpO₂ is defined as the percentage of oxyhaemoglobin (HbO₂) to the total concentration of haemoglobin (HbO₂ + deoxyhaemoglobin) in peripheral blood.

localizedDescriptions.en: Findings observed during the physical examination of a subject of care.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during a physical examination of a patient.

annotations.comment: May be used to record a narrative summary of the complete clinical examination or key aspects of clinical examination findings, which will be supported by structured data. Details of specific structured findings can be included using CLUSTER archetypes in the 'Examination Detail' slot. This data element may be used to capture legacy data that is not available in a structured format.

localizedDescriptions.en: A media file that is acquired or used as part of the healthcare process, and associated metadata.
Digital representation of the media file.

annotations.comment: If the file is stored locally, the actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the file is stored at a location outside of the health record, the detailed path to the file is captured using the URI attribute in the Multimedia data type. The Multimedia data type has many RM attributes such as the size of file and URI to an external source - see https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class.

localizedDescriptions.en: Descriptive name or title for the media file.

annotations.comment: A description of the content of the media file. Use an agreed standardised naming convention, if available. For example: "Right hand burn #1" or "Cardiology video consultation on May 2".

localizedDescriptions.en: Unique ID for the media file.
Narrative description about the media file.
The date/time, partial date or period when the media file was generated or authored.
A media file that is acquired or used as part of the healthcare process, and associated metadata.
Digital representation of the media file.

annotations.comment: If the file is stored locally, the actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the file is stored at a location outside of the health record, the detailed path to the file is captured using the URI attribute in the Multimedia data type. The Multimedia data type has many RM attributes such as the size of file and URI to an external source - see https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class.

localizedDescriptions.en: Descriptive name or title for the media file.

annotations.comment: A description of the content of the media file. Use an agreed standardised naming convention, if available. For example: "Right hand burn #1" or "Cardiology video consultation on May 2".

localizedDescriptions.en: Unique ID for the media file.
Narrative description about the media file.
The date/time, partial date or period when the media file was generated or authored.
Additional narrative about the media file not captured in other fields.
Single word, phrase or brief description which represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.

annotations.comment: Coding with a terminology is preferred, if possible. For example, 'normal examination' or 'tympanic membrane perforation'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the overall physical examination findings not captured in other fields.
Description of any incidental factors that may have contributed to the physical examination findings.
The body position of the subject during the examination.
Measurement of the electrical activity generated by the heart.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

annotations.comment: Coding of the ECG type with a terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Standard ECG'; or '15-lead ECG'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The frequency of atrial electrical contractions across the ECG as a whole (multiple leads).

annotations.comment: Also known as the PP rate. The atrial heart rate is measured from P wave to P wave.

localizedDescriptions.en: The frequency of ventricular electrical contractions across the ECG as a whole (multiple leads).

annotations.comment: Also known as the RR rate, QRS rate or electrical heart rate. The ventricular heart rate is measured from R wave to R wave and calculated across the ECG as a whole (multiple leads).

localizedDescriptions.en: Interval measurement from the onset of the QRS complex to the end of the T wave aacross the ECG as a whole (multiple leads).
Correction applied to the 'QT interval global'.
PR interval measurement across the ECG as a whole (multiple leads).

annotations.comment: The PR interval is measured from onset of P wave to the onset of QRS complex.

localizedDescriptions.en: Duration of QRS complex across the ECG as a whole (multiple leads).

annotations.comment:
The QRS complex is measured from its onset to 
the ST segment onset (J point).

localizedDescriptions.en: The interval between successive R waves across the ECG as a whole (multiple leads).

annotations.comment: The RR interval is measured as the time interval between successive R waves.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results.

annotations.comment: This data element may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the ECG request.

localizedDescriptions.en: Interpretative comment on this ECG result, originating from a device.

annotations.comment: May be multiple. Coding of the interpretation with a terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: normal sinus rhythm; ischaemic ST-T changes in anterior leads; and/or poor R progression in right precordial leads.

localizedDescriptions.en: Single word, phrase or brief description that represents a significant finding in the ECG result.

annotations.comment: For example: 'Normal ECG', 'Equivocal ECG' or 'Abnormal ECG'; 'Spikes from pacemaker signal'; 'ST depression'; or 'Atrial fibrillation'. Coding of the finding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the overall clinical meaning and significance of the ECG result.

annotations.comment: For example: 'posterior AMI' or 'supraventricular tachycardia'. Coding of the diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible. This diagnosis should be aligned with the narrative in the 'Conclusion'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative synthesis about all of the key findings in the ECG result.

annotations.comment: The conclusion is intended to be a narrative and expanded version of the 'ECG diagnosis'. For example: 'Normal sinus rhythm with ischaemic ST-T changes in anterior leads and poor R progression in right precordial leads; or comparison with previous ECG results.

localizedDescriptions.en: A media file that is acquired or used as part of the healthcare process, and associated metadata.
Digital representation of the media file.

annotations.comment: If the file is stored locally, the actual content will be captured and stored using the Multimedia data type. For example: RTF or PDF for a document; JPG for an image; MP4 for a video; or WAV for an audio file. If the file is stored at a location outside of the health record, the detailed path to the file is captured using the URI attribute in the Multimedia data type. The Multimedia data type has many RM attributes such as the size of file and URI to an external source - see https://specifications.openehr.org/releases/RM/latest/data_types.html#_dv_multimedia_class.

localizedDescriptions.en: Descriptive name or title for the media file.

annotations.comment: A description of the content of the media file. Use an agreed standardised naming convention, if available. For example: "Right hand burn #1" or "Cardiology video consultation on May 2".

localizedDescriptions.en: Unique ID for the media file.
Narrative description about the media file.
The date/time, partial date or period when the media file was generated or authored.
Additional narrative about the media file not captured in other fields.
Additional narrative about the ECG result, not captured in other fields.
Average direction of electrical activity during atrial depolarization.
Average direction of electrical activity during atrial depolarization.

annotations.comment: For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.

localizedDescriptions.en: Average direction of electrical activity during atrial depolarization.

annotations.comment: For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.
For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.

localizedDescriptions.en: Average direction of electrical activity during ventricular depolarization.
Average direction of electrical activity during ventricular depolarization.

annotations.comment: For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.

localizedDescriptions.en: Average direction of electrical activity during ventricular depolarization.

annotations.comment: For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.
For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.

localizedDescriptions.en: Average direction of electrical activity during ventricular repolarization.
Average direction of electrical activity during ventricular repolarization.

annotations.comment: For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.

localizedDescriptions.en: Average direction of electrical activity during ventricular repolarization.

annotations.comment: For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.
For example: normal axis or left deviation; or number of degrees.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about measured parameters for each named lead (specified in the run-time name constraint).
Narrative description about the findings for the specified lead.

annotations.comment: For example: ST segment findings.

localizedDescriptions.en: Area of a monophasic P wave or the area of the initial portion of a biphasic P wave.
Area of the terminal portion of a biphasic P wave.
Interval from the onset of the QRS complex to the latest positive peak in the complex, or the latest substantial notch on the latest peak (whichever is later).
Amplitude of the peak-to-peak QRS complex.

annotations.comment: Measured from its onset to the ST segment onset (J point).

localizedDescriptions.en: Elevation or depression at the onset (J point) of the ST segment.
Elevation or depression at the midpoint of the ST segment.
Elevation or depression of the ST segment 80 ms after the end of the QRS complex (J point).
Elevation or depression of the ST segment 60 ms after the end of the QRS complex (J point).
Elevation or depression at the end of the ST segment.

annotations.comment: Slope is measured in degrees for 25 mm/sec, 1mV/cm scaling.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ST segment is depressed but not sloping. This is a more specific form of 'ST depression'.
The ST segment is depressed and sloping upward. This is a more specific form of 'ST depression'.
The ST segment is depressed and downsloping. This is a more specific form of 'ST depression'.

annotations.comment: Value set sourced from DICOM PS3.16 2018 c - Content Mapping Resource -http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/html/part16.html#sect_CID_3233

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the lead results, not captured in other fields.

Details about measured parameters for each named lead (specified in the run-time name constraint).
Narrative description about the findings for the specified lead.

annotations.comment: For example: ST segment findings.

localizedDescriptions.en: Area of a monophasic P wave or the area of the initial portion of a biphasic P wave.
Area of the terminal portion of a biphasic P wave.
Interval from the onset of the QRS complex to the latest positive peak in the complex, or the latest substantial notch on the latest peak (whichever is later).
Amplitude of the peak-to-peak QRS complex.

annotations.comment: Measured from its onset to the ST segment onset (J point).

localizedDescriptions.en: Elevation or depression at the onset (J point) of the ST segment.
Elevation or depression at the midpoint of the ST segment.
Elevation or depression of the ST segment 80 ms after the end of the QRS complex (J point).
Elevation or depression of the ST segment 60 ms after the end of the QRS complex (J point).
Elevation or depression at the end of the ST segment.

annotations.comment: Slope is measured in degrees for 25 mm/sec, 1mV/cm scaling.

localizedDescriptions.en: The ST segment is depressed but not sloping. This is a more specific form of 'ST depression'.
The ST segment is depressed and sloping upward. This is a more specific form of 'ST depression'.
The ST segment is depressed and downsloping. This is a more specific form of 'ST depression'.

annotations.comment: Value set sourced from DICOM PS3.16 2018 c - Content Mapping Resource -http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/html/part16.html#sect_CID_3233

annotations.comment: Value set sourced from DICOM PS3.16 2018 c - Content Mapping Resource -http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/html/part16.html#sect_CID_3233

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the lead results, not captured in other fields.
Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be contributing to ECG result.

annotations.comment: For example: Uncooperative patient; difficulty with lead placement; or moist skin.
This free text field could be further coded in a template to enable a Present/Absent value set if required for reporting purposes.

localizedDescriptions.en: The position of the subject at the time of measurement.
Standing at the time of ECG testing.
Sitting (for example on bed or chair) at the time of ECG testing.
Reclining at the time of ECG testing.
Lying flat at the time of ECG testing.
Lying flat with some lateral tilt, usually angled towards the left side at the time of ECG testing.
The craniocaudal tilt of the surface on which the person is lying during the ECG. Lying horizontally is considered the 0 degrees position.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents a significant technical quality issue that impacts the ECG result.

annotations.comment: For example: codes from IHE ECG codetable, such as 'Incomplete ECG'; 'Limb electrodes interchanged'; or 'Muscle tremor'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Lead placement for the ECG recording.

annotations.comment: For example: 'Standard 12-lead extended to the right by V5R, V4R, V3R'. Coding of the lead placement with a terminology, such as DICOM CID 3263/ISO 11073 MDC codes, is desirable where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Algorithm used to correct QT interval.
Comment about the interpretation by the device.

annotations.comment: For example: identification of the algorithm used; or description of technical limitations.
Also known as an electrocardiograph or EKG.
